website_summaries.verdict: Between the powerful nature of this air die grinder and its angled design, it’s an impressive choice for at home projects or a shop.
pros: Tool delivers a wealth of power – enough to cut through decently thick parts
Angled design makes it easy to use with precision
A compact size and has a lightweight design for easy handling
Speed control trigger is a nice touch
cons: Exhaust is forward facing, which could pose a problem with oil spray

website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight pneumatic angle die grinder with a fourth-inch collet capable of reaching 21,000 RPM.
pros: A solid unit that is manufactured with durability in mind
It is constructed using a ball-bearing design to increase the grinder's lifespan while helping to reduce vibrations
The throttle features a safety lock to prevent accidental starting
cons: Although it is a matter of preference, it is important to note this tool has a front exhaust, which may or may not be to your liking

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: As much as it pains me because this is and was a very nice die grinder, but it sucks and I still have it but never use it I opt for others that function better. Over all there is no difference other then it falls apart on me and for something that cost 3 times as much as my best die grinder that’s saying something. I like to buy good brands and this was a huge let down
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Com'on ingersoll
customer_reviews.text: I used it light duty about 15x's and had it for 5 months. Mostly use sandy pads to clean up u-joint yokes.
customer_reviews.author: adam harrison

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: head nut keeps coming loose tried tightening it but after a few mins comes loose again
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and adequate performance.
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality as expected from IR. Performance is good, not great. Adequate for daily use as a surface prep. tool for light gasket surface cleaning jobs. The exhaust is forward facing, exiting toward the work surface. This can be a problem when working around coolant and oil that you do not want to spray all over. Consider this, many other models have exhaust exiting the back of the tool. The safety mechanism is long & cumbersome in tight spots, so i removed it and was pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used this and 6-gal compressor to sharpen some tools
customer_reviews.text: Bought this together with some green Type R zirconia sanding discs so I could sharpen the blade on my gas hedge pruner. I'm not a big air compressor/impact tool guy - all I have is a little 6-gal pancake compressor - but I was able to sharpen my pruner and some other garden tools with this setup as long as I paused every once in awhile to let the compressor catch up.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Have two now!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a second one. Tired of swapping sanding disks with rotating brushes, so I just bought another. Now I have one dedicated for sanding, and another for wire brush cleaning. Only thing I don't like about these is the safety. Sometimes hard to manipulate in tight places, and tough triggering the lever.
customer_reviews.author: fmwardalotTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great air tool
customer_reviews.text: I work in welding and metal fab, and use this tool on a daily basis, mostly with 2" Roloc style discs for light deburring of mild tube steel. It gets a considerable amount of use and performs flawlessly, although I do keep it well oiled. I did disable the safety feature, so sometimes it will walk across the table if I'm not paying attention how I set it down. It gets a big thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best in the industry.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this die grinder for about 2 years and have used it almost daily as a class 7/ class 8 diesel truck mechanic. Ingersoll Rand has been and still is the pinnacle of pneumatic tools, for the money this has been the best for all my light to medium grinding work. It still works as good as the day i bought it even though it's been rode hard and put up wet. Literally! One time the auto water drain failed on the shop compressor and it was almost like pumping straight water through it. Drained the tank and shes good to go. 5 stars would recommend as great price, above average quality and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason it is so highly reviewed
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this tool. I use it to debur surfaces and clean them for welding. The collet tightens and doesn't let the shaft of your mandrel slip. The tool is lightweight and powerful. There is a reason that it is highly recommended among professional tool users.
customer_reviews.author: HandyDan

customer_reviews.title: great little die grinder
customer_reviews.text: working on a project, and my trusty dusty straight head grinder just was not going to do the job...ordered this angle head, it came within a week, and ta da, project complete. Is a durable, great product for the cost! So glad i have one now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this almost everyday for over a month in an auto shop. Works great. Replaced my last IR die grinder that I used for over 10 years
customer_reviews.author: Jay Panganiban

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This has been used almost entirely for grinding down the inside of tires for patches. I have done very minimal oiling for the amount of times I have used it but it shows no signs of issues. It does not include a head that accepts sanding cookies so that will have to be purchased elsewhere. I would recommend definitely recommend this tool for basic grinding applications.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats the cheap ones
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one for years and it has always worked. Got another one so I would not have to change bits all the time. I’m a serious hobbyists and use it often. Just keep it oiled
customer_reviews.author: Allen Knack

customer_reviews.title: Super-Light-Weight
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a larger, heavier, single speed grinder. The variable speed control is handier than you would think. The extra control was unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line.
customer_reviews.text: Rather have ingerscoll, dotco, taylor than mag tools or snap on all day. Its a harley davison of tools, pay for a name and act as who can outpay for supplies. Just makes no sense, like a wratchet costs 70-130$ by mag, or snap on, can get a craftsman that does the same, and still have some that are 20+ years old and still works brand new like i just opened it. All how your respect your tools at the end of the day and your money.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: works great, gets cold after extended use
customer_reviews.text: works great, gets cold after extended use. if you work in a shop its great. home use is a little much unless you like having nice things. prime ordered. got here quick. requires speed adjustment right out of the box. works great! always use IR
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to burnish my wife's noisy brakes. Used the red roloc pads on her rotors and pads and they quieted her squeak right up! A really nice tool for the price
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra doe-rae-me!
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a set of 2 inch prepping set with paint removal, cleaning discs, and a variety of sanding discs to clean up a cast iron pan I purchased to see if smoothing the cast would help pan. Worked great. Recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: drrx07

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase on Amazon yet!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended, put this baby to the test ran it for an hour straight out of the box non-stop, no oiling or anything. Almost killed my compressor but the tool works amazingly!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Do not use every dat, I wanted a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Make sure everything is tightened down before you this product
customer_reviews.text: Usually Ingersoll makes good product but I guess I got the lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Guner

customer_reviews.title: Good for DIY'ers
customer_reviews.text: Held up for 4 years under professional use. Always had issues with the head unscrewing. You get what you pay for.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate description
customer_reviews.text: The item received was exactly as described. Feels very durable.

customer_reviews.title: Angle grinder
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes this product and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.text: Already used. Absolutly great. Nice looks, power, easy to remove attatchments. Love it. Priced just right. Feels good in the hand.

customer_reviews.title: As expected from an IR
customer_reviews.text: Good dye grinder, only reason I give a 4 star is because I received mine with pink stains all over, indicating that it has been opened at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Younes

customer_reviews.title: Great budget die grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great little die grinder for the budget minded. It's decently lightweight for being all metal constructed. Plenty of power to cut, grind and clean surfaces. It looks pretty good too. It's worth buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: That it was like it described
customer_reviews.text: I am a vw mechanic and used this tool almost on daily basis and I was impressed how good it work for the price is a good tool very happy I am buying one more just to have a backup
customer_reviews.author: Rojichivas

customer_reviews.title: Works...had it for a fre months with no issues
customer_reviews.text: Works well...used it a dozen times with cut off wheels and grinding pads and have had no issues. Seems a little noisy as others have said but I don't use this as a professional does everyday, so that is not an issue for me. Does require a large compressor behind it though since it will use up your air.

customer_reviews.title: Ghe best
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. Its works as designed. I like the IR and its cheep on here instead on other tool stors or company. Im happy. There os no dislike about it.

customer_reviews.text: Spent the day using this tool with a wire wheel. And it has made life of cleaning auto parts so easy.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, cheap wrenches
customer_reviews.text: Tool is great for deburring and cleaning/grinding. The wrenches are garbage, and collet is milled too narrowly for normal box end wrenches- I’m spending shop time making wrenches to swap wheels and fix IR’s corner cutting :(
customer_reviews.author: Jim Up North

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great brand.
customer_reviews.text: Been using for almost 2 years heavily every single week. With your basic maintenance of using air tool oil and ensuring the head is greased, this thing is still running like it's brand new. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I bought this. It's one of my go to tools at work when I'm cleaning up spatter after I'm welding mild steel or flux core food grade. It saves me so much time instead of using a die-grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Szary

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Used by a Technician.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a quality tool. No need to buy an expensive truck brand. Used frequently in a professional automotive setting by a Technician.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I am an automotive tech so I used this little guy several times a day and so far it had held up really well!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Front exhaust is nice. Feels good in my hand
customer_reviews.text: Got it supper quick! Much quieter than the Harbor Freight junk I had before. Much less vibration than I'm used to. Front exhaust is nice. Feels good in my hand. I'm 6'4" so not small...Their huge...Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little grinder for the money. Low vibration and plenty of power. It's nice and small so it will fit in tight areas. The front exhaust is nice so it doesn't blow oil all over your hands. Love to it comes with an extra 6mm collet
customer_reviews.author: Colton Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: No r compliment to my air tools. Don’t know how I’ve done without so long.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Tool is compact enough to get into ...

customer_reviews.text: The item is a replacement for a CH unit , I have used it twice and it performed as described

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent cutter
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time and have found the RPMs inconsistent. I'm not sure if it's just breaking in. I did complete the job and it seemed to get better after an hour of use. Feels heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Badass Grinder
customer_reviews.text: As a Shipwright I use this tool every other day, and I can say it’s badass. For its small size, you can’t beat the power. Perfect for less proferful, more nimble work. Just oil it before and after if you like your air tools!
customer_reviews.author: ANGELINE STANDBRIDGE

customer_reviews.title: Light, well balanced tool
customer_reviews.text: Good solid tool, with nice balance. Doesn’t feel awkward or heavy in the hand, as some die grinders do. First time purchasing this brand, and will look to them in the future for any other tools later needed.

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove. Even though it is made overseas it feels well made. Came with two different collets. You will need to purchase the air inlet stem (auto/Industrial), a oil/water separator and a 2" 1/4 shaft roloc disc holder. I use the TEKTON 4755 Oil/Water Separator to a coil line to the grinder.

product_meta.title: Ingersoll Rand 301B Air Angle Die Grinder,Black
product_meta.description:
Long-lasting, economical, and ideal for general-purpose grinding, the 301B delivers a number of beneficial features in one compact package. Right-angle configuration provides easy access to tight spots, so you can grind, break sharp edges, de-burr, port, and polish virtually anywhere.

AMAZON.COM


Long lasting, economical, and ideal for general-purpose grinding, the Ingersoll Rand 301B Air Angle Die Grinder delivers a number of beneficial features in one compact package. Right-angle configuration provides easy access to tight spots, so you can grind, break sharp edges, de-burr, port, and polish virtually anywhere. The 301B has a 0.25 hp motor that delivers a free speed of 21,000 rpm.

Great for grinding, breaking sharp edges, deburring, porting, and polishing (view larger). The 301B's strong aluminum housing withstands tough operating conditions, and its durable ball-bearing construction improves balance, reduces vibration, and ensures a longer life. The small, lightweight design provides easy operation, and greater access to tight spots, while an integral safety-lock throttle lever prevents accidental start-up. It also features a front exhaust to help you keep work surfaces clean. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
301B Air Angle Die Grinder; 1/4-inch and 6 mm collets; two wrenches; operating instructions

ABOUT INGERSOLL RAND
Ingersoll Rand designs, builds, and delivers an unrivaled assortment of hard-working products and solutions. Ingersoll Rand is a multi-billion dollar global company that has built a reputation for keeping its customers up and running for over a century. From our complete compressed air systems, to our tools, pumps, material handling systems and comprehensive services, Ingersoll Rand offers the depth of knowledge, expertise, and experience to provide the best solution to meet your needs.

SPECIFICATIONS
Power Free Speed RPM Output Collet Size Average Air Consumption Air Consumption @ Load Sound Pressure / Power 0.25 hp (0.19 kW) 21,000 1/4-inch, 6mm 6 cfm (170 L/minute) 24 cfm (680 L/minute) 92/105 dBA Air Inlet NPTF In Minimum Hose Size Air Pressure Exhaust Direction Product Length Product Weight 1/4-inch 3/8-inch (10mm) 90 psi (6.2 bar) Front 5.27 inches 1.02 pounds 301B AIR ANGLE DIE GRINDER
AT A GLANCE
 * Powerful motor delivers 0.25 HP (0.19 kW) and 21,000 rpm free speed
 * Durable ball-bearing construction
 * Strong aluminum housing 
 * Safety-lock throttle lever prevents accidental start up
 * Front exhaust
feature_bullets: For automotive and light maintenance applications
Durable and long lasting, with an all ball bearing construction and precision-machined steel gears
Self-locking throttle lever prevents accidental starting of motor
Front exhaust helps keep work surface clean
